10475  json_value(number_integer_t v) noexcept : number_integer(v) {}
10477  json_value(number_unsigned_t v) noexcept : number_unsigned(v) {}
10479  json_value(number_float_t v) noexcept : number_float(v) {}
10481  json_value(value_t t)
10482  {
10483  switch (t)
10484  {
10485  case value_t::object:
10486  {
10487  object = create<object_t>();
10488  break;
10489  }
10490 
10491  case value_t::array:
10492  {
10493  array = create<array_t>();
10494  break;
10495  }
10496 
10497  case value_t::string:
10498  {
10499  string = create<string_t>("");
10500  break;
10501  }
10502 
10503  case value_t::boolean:
10504  {
10505  boolean = boolean_t(false);
10506  break;
10507  }
10508 
10509  case value_t::number_integer:
10510  {
10511  number_integer = number_integer_t(0);
10512  break;
10513  }
10514 
10515  case value_t::number_unsigned:
10516  {
10517  number_unsigned = number_unsigned_t(0);
10518  break;
10519  }
10520 
10521  case value_t::number_float:
10522  {
10523  number_float = number_float_t(0.0);
10524  break;
10525  }
10526 
10527  case value_t::null:
10528  {
10529  object = nullptr; // silence warning, see #821
10530  break;
10531  }
10532 
10533  default:
10534  {
10535  object = nullptr; // silence warning, see #821
10536  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(t == value_t::null))
10537  {
10538  JSON_THROW(other_error::create(500, "961c151d2e87f2686a955a9be24d316f1362bf21 3.1.1")); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
10539  }
10540  break;
10541  }
10542  }
10543  }
10544 
10546  json_value(const string_t& value)
10547  {
10548  string = create<string_t>(value);
10549  }
10550 
10552  json_value(string_t&& value)
10553  {
10554  string = create<string_t>(std::move(value));
10555  }
10556 
10558  json_value(const object_t& value)
10559  {
10560  object = create<object_t>(value);
10561  }
10562 
10564  json_value(object_t&& value)
10565  {
10566  object = create<object_t>(std::move(value));
10567  }
10568 
10570  json_value(const array_t& value)
10571  {
10572  array = create<array_t>(value);
10573  }
10574 
10576  json_value(array_t&& value)
10577  {
10578  array = create<array_t>(std::move(value));
10579  }
10580 
10581  void destroy(value_t t) noexcept
10582  {
10583  switch (t)
10584  {
10585  case value_t::object:
10586  {
10587  AllocatorType<object_t> alloc;
10588  std::allocator_traits<decltype(alloc)>::destroy(alloc, object);
10589  std::allocator_traits<decltype(alloc)>::deallocate(alloc, object, 1);
10590  break;
10591  }
10592 
10593  case value_t::array:
10594  {
10595  AllocatorType<array_t> alloc;
10596  std::allocator_traits<decltype(alloc)>::destroy(alloc, array);
10597  std::allocator_traits<decltype(alloc)>::deallocate(alloc, array, 1);
10598  break;
10599  }
10600 
10601  case value_t::string:
10602  {
10603  AllocatorType<string_t> alloc;
10604  std::allocator_traits<decltype(alloc)>::destroy(alloc, string);
10605  std::allocator_traits<decltype(alloc)>::deallocate(alloc, string, 1);
10606  break;
10607  }
10608 
10609  default:
10610  {
10611  break;
10612  }
10613  }
10614  }
10615  };
10616 
10626  void assert_invariant() const noexcept
10627  {
10628  assert(m_type != value_t::object or m_value.object != nullptr);
10629  assert(m_type != value_t::array or m_value.array != nullptr);
10630  assert(m_type != value_t::string or m_value.string != nullptr);
10631  }
10632 
10633  public:
10635  // JSON parser callback //
10637 
10653  using parse_event_t = typename parser::parse_event_t;
10654 
10704  using parser_callback_t = typename parser::parser_callback_t;
10705 
10706 
10708  // constructors //
10710 
10715 
10745  basic_json(const value_t v)
10746  : m_type(v), m_value(v)
10747  {
10748  assert_invariant();
10749  }
10750 
10769  basic_json(std::nullptr_t = nullptr) noexcept
10770  : basic_json(value_t::null)
10771  {
10772  assert_invariant();
10773  }
10774 
10831  template <typename CompatibleType,
10832  typename U = detail::uncvref_t<CompatibleType>,
10833  detail::enable_if_t<
10834  detail::is_compatible_type<basic_json_t, U>::value, int> = 0>
10835  basic_json(CompatibleType && val) noexcept(noexcept(
10836  JSONSerializer<U>::to_json(std::declval<basic_json_t&>(),
10837  std::forward<CompatibleType>(val))))
10838  {
10839  JSONSerializer<U>::to_json(*this, std::forward<CompatibleType>(val));
10840  assert_invariant();
10841  }
10842 
10917  basic_json(initializer_list_t init,
10918  bool type_deduction = true,
10919  value_t manual_type = value_t::array)
10920  {
10921  // check if each element is an array with two elements whose first
10922  // element is a string
10923  bool is_an_object = std::all_of(init.begin(), init.end(),
10924  [](const detail::json_ref<basic_json>& element_ref)
10925  {
10926  return (element_ref->is_array() and element_ref->size() == 2 and (*element_ref)[0].is_string());
10927  });
10928 
10929  // adjust type if type deduction is not wanted
10930  if (not type_deduction)
10931  {
10932  // if array is wanted, do not create an object though possible
10933  if (manual_type == value_t::array)
10934  {
10935  is_an_object = false;
10936  }
10937 
10938  // if object is wanted but impossible, throw an exception
10939  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(manual_type == value_t::object and not is_an_object))
10940  {
10941  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(301, "cannot create object from initializer list"));
10942  }
10943  }
10944 
10945  if (is_an_object)
10946  {
10947  // the initializer list is a list of pairs -> create object
10948  m_type = value_t::object;
10949  m_value = value_t::object;
10950 
10951  std::for_each(init.begin(), init.end(), [this](const detail::json_ref<basic_json>& element_ref)
10952  {
10953  auto element = element_ref.moved_or_copied();
10954  m_value.object->emplace(
10955  std::move(*((*element.m_value.array)[0].m_value.string)),
10956  std::move((*element.m_value.array)[1]));
10957  });
10958  }
10959  else
10960  {
10961  // the initializer list describes an array -> create array
10962  m_type = value_t::array;
10963  m_value.array = create<array_t>(init.begin(), init.end());
10964  }
10965 
10966  assert_invariant();
10967  }
10968 
11006  static basic_json array(initializer_list_t init = {})
11007  {
11008  return basic_json(init, false, value_t::array);
11009  }
11010 
11049  static basic_json object(initializer_list_t init = {})
11050  {
11051  return basic_json(init, false, value_t::object);
11052  }
11053 
11076  basic_json(size_type cnt, const basic_json& val)
11077  : m_type(value_t::array)
11078  {
11079  m_value.array = create<array_t>(cnt, val);
11080  assert_invariant();
11081  }
11082 
11138  template<class InputIT, typename std::enable_if<
11139  std::is_same<InputIT, typename basic_json_t::iterator>::value or
11140  std::is_same<InputIT, typename basic_json_t::const_iterator>::value, int>::type = 0>
11141  basic_json(InputIT first, InputIT last)
11142  {
11143  assert(first.m_object != nullptr);
11144  assert(last.m_object != nullptr);
11145 
11146  // make sure iterator fits the current value
11147  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(first.m_object != last.m_object))
11148  {
11149  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(201, "iterators are not compatible"));
11150  }
11151 
11152  // copy type from first iterator
11153  m_type = first.m_object->m_type;
11154 
11155  // check if iterator range is complete for primitive values
11156  switch (m_type)
11157  {
11158  case value_t::boolean:
11159  case value_t::number_float:
11160  case value_t::number_integer:
11161  case value_t::number_unsigned:
11162  case value_t::string:
11163  {
11164  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not first.m_it.primitive_iterator.is_begin()
11165  or not last.m_it.primitive_iterator.is_end()))
11166  {
11167  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(204, "iterators out of range"));
11168  }
11169  break;
11170  }
11171 
11172  default:
11173  break;
11174  }
11175 
11176  switch (m_type)
11177  {
11178  case value_t::number_integer:
11179  {
11180  m_value.number_integer = first.m_object->m_value.number_integer;
11181  break;
11182  }
11183 
11184  case value_t::number_unsigned:
11185  {
11186  m_value.number_unsigned = first.m_object->m_value.number_unsigned;
11187  break;
11188  }
11189 
11190  case value_t::number_float:
11191  {
11192  m_value.number_float = first.m_object->m_value.number_float;
11193  break;
11194  }
11195 
11196  case value_t::boolean:
11197  {
11198  m_value.boolean = first.m_object->m_value.boolean;
11199  break;
11200  }
11201 
11202  case value_t::string:
11203  {
11204  m_value = *first.m_object->m_value.string;
11205  break;
11206  }
11207 
11208  case value_t::object:
11209  {
11210  m_value.object = create<object_t>(first.m_it.object_iterator,
11211  last.m_it.object_iterator);
11212  break;
11213  }
11214 
11215  case value_t::array:
11216  {
11217  m_value.array = create<array_t>(first.m_it.array_iterator,
11218  last.m_it.array_iterator);
11219  break;
11220  }
11221 
11222  default:
11223  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(206, "cannot construct with iterators from " +
11224  std::string(first.m_object->type_name())));
11225  }
11226 
11227  assert_invariant();
11228  }
11229 
11230 
11232  // other constructors and destructor //
11234 
11236  basic_json(const detail::json_ref<basic_json>& ref)
11237  : basic_json(ref.moved_or_copied())
11238  {}
11239 
11265  basic_json(const basic_json& other)
11266  : m_type(other.m_type)
11267  {
11268  // check of passed value is valid
11269  other.assert_invariant();
11270 
11271  switch (m_type)
11272  {
11273  case value_t::object:
11274  {
11275  m_value = *other.m_value.object;
11276  break;
11277  }
11278 
11279  case value_t::array:
11280  {
11281  m_value = *other.m_value.array;
11282  break;
11283  }
11284 
11285  case value_t::string:
11286  {
11287  m_value = *other.m_value.string;
11288  break;
11289  }
11290 
11291  case value_t::boolean:
11292  {
11293  m_value = other.m_value.boolean;
11294  break;
11295  }
11296 
11297  case value_t::number_integer:
11298  {
11299  m_value = other.m_value.number_integer;
11300  break;
11301  }
11302 
11303  case value_t::number_unsigned:
11304  {
11305  m_value = other.m_value.number_unsigned;
11306  break;
11307  }
11308 
11309  case value_t::number_float:
11310  {
11311  m_value = other.m_value.number_float;
11312  break;
11313  }
11314 
11315  default:
11316  break;
11317  }
11318 
11319  assert_invariant();
11320  }
11321 
11348  basic_json(basic_json&& other) noexcept
11349  : m_type(std::move(other.m_type)),
11350  m_value(std::move(other.m_value))
11351  {
11352  // check that passed value is valid
11353  other.assert_invariant();
11354 
11355  // invalidate payload
11356  other.m_type = value_t::null;
11357  other.m_value = {};
11358 
11359  assert_invariant();
11360  }
11361 
11385  reference& operator=(basic_json other) noexcept (
11386  std::is_nothrow_move_constructible<value_t>::value and
11387  std::is_nothrow_move_assignable<value_t>::value and
11388  std::is_nothrow_move_constructible<json_value>::value and
11389  std::is_nothrow_move_assignable<json_value>::value
11390  )
11391  {
11392  // check that passed value is valid
11393  other.assert_invariant();
11394 
11395  using std::swap;
11396  swap(m_type, other.m_type);
11397  swap(m_value, other.m_value);
11398 
11399  assert_invariant();
11400  return *this;
11401  }
11402 
11418  ~basic_json() noexcept
11419  {
11420  assert_invariant();
11421  m_value.destroy(m_type);
11422  }
11423 
11425 
11426  public:
11428  // object inspection //
11430 
11434 
11471  string_t dump(const int indent = -1, const char indent_char = ' ',
11472  const bool ensure_ascii = false) const
11473  {
11474  string_t result;
11475  serializer s(detail::output_adapter<char>(result), indent_char);
11476 
11477  if (indent >= 0)
11478  {
11479  s.dump(*this, true, ensure_ascii, static_cast<unsigned int>(indent));
11480  }
11481  else
11482  {
11483  s.dump(*this, false, ensure_ascii, 0);
11484  }
11485 
11486  return result;
11487  }
11488 
11521  constexpr value_t type() const noexcept
11522  {
11523  return m_type;
11524  }
11525 
11551  constexpr bool is_primitive() const noexcept
11552  {
11553  return is_null() or is_string() or is_boolean() or is_number();
11554  }
11555 
11578  constexpr bool is_structured() const noexcept
11579  {
11580  return is_array() or is_object();
11581  }
11582 
11600  constexpr bool is_null() const noexcept
11601  {
11602  return (m_type == value_t::null);
11603  }
11604 
11622  constexpr bool is_boolean() const noexcept
11623  {
11624  return (m_type == value_t::boolean);
11625  }
11626 
11652  constexpr bool is_number() const noexcept
11653  {
11654  return is_number_integer() or is_number_float();
11655  }
11656 
11681  constexpr bool is_number_integer() const noexcept
11682  {
11683  return (m_type == value_t::number_integer or m_type == value_t::number_unsigned);
11684  }
11685 
11709  constexpr bool is_number_unsigned() const noexcept
11710  {
11711  return (m_type == value_t::number_unsigned);
11712  }
11713 
11737  constexpr bool is_number_float() const noexcept
11738  {
11739  return (m_type == value_t::number_float);
11740  }
11741 
11759  constexpr bool is_object() const noexcept
11760  {
11761  return (m_type == value_t::object);
11762  }
11763 
11781  constexpr bool is_array() const noexcept
11782  {
11783  return (m_type == value_t::array);
11784  }
11785 
11803  constexpr bool is_string() const noexcept
11804  {
11805  return (m_type == value_t::string);
11806  }
11807 
11830  constexpr bool is_discarded() const noexcept
11831  {
11832  return (m_type == value_t::discarded);
11833  }

11856  constexpr operator value_t() const noexcept
11857  {
11858  return m_type;
11859  }

11869  boolean_t get_impl(boolean_t* /*unused*/) const
11870  {
11871  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_boolean()))
11872  {
11873  return m_value.boolean;
11874  }
11875 
11876  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be boolean, but is " + std::string(type_name())));
11877  }
11878 
11880  object_t* get_impl_ptr(object_t* /*unused*/) noexcept
11881  {
11882  return is_object() ? m_value.object : nullptr;
11883  }
11884 
11886  constexpr const object_t* get_impl_ptr(const object_t* /*unused*/) const noexcept
11887  {
11888  return is_object() ? m_value.object : nullptr;
11889  }
11890 
11892  array_t* get_impl_ptr(array_t* /*unused*/) noexcept
11893  {
11894  return is_array() ? m_value.array : nullptr;
11895  }
11896 
11898  constexpr const array_t* get_impl_ptr(const array_t* /*unused*/) const noexcept
11899  {
11900  return is_array() ? m_value.array : nullptr;
11901  }
11902 
11904  string_t* get_impl_ptr(string_t* /*unused*/) noexcept
11905  {
11906  return is_string() ? m_value.string : nullptr;
11907  }
11908 
11910  constexpr const string_t* get_impl_ptr(const string_t* /*unused*/) const noexcept
11911  {
11912  return is_string() ? m_value.string : nullptr;
11913  }
11914 
11916  boolean_t* get_impl_ptr(boolean_t* /*unused*/) noexcept
11917  {
11918  return is_boolean() ? &m_value.boolean : nullptr;
11919  }
11920 
11922  constexpr const boolean_t* get_impl_ptr(const boolean_t* /*unused*/) const noexcept
11923  {
11924  return is_boolean() ? &m_value.boolean : nullptr;
11925  }
11926 
11928  number_integer_t* get_impl_ptr(number_integer_t* /*unused*/) noexcept
11929  {
11930  return is_number_integer() ? &m_value.number_integer : nullptr;
11931  }
11932 
11934  constexpr const number_integer_t* get_impl_ptr(const number_integer_t* /*unused*/) const noexcept
11935  {
11936  return is_number_integer() ? &m_value.number_integer : nullptr;
11937  }
11938 
11940  number_unsigned_t* get_impl_ptr(number_unsigned_t* /*unused*/) noexcept
11941  {
11942  return is_number_unsigned() ? &m_value.number_unsigned : nullptr;
11943  }
11944

11947  {
11948  return is_number_unsigned() ? &m_value.number_unsigned : nullptr;
11949  }

11952  number_float_t* get_impl_ptr(number_float_t* /*unused*/) noexcept
11953  {
11954  return is_number_float() ? &m_value.number_float : nullptr;
11955  }
11956 
11958  constexpr const number_float_t* get_impl_ptr(const number_float_t* /*unused*/) const noexcept
11959  {
11960  return is_number_float() ? &m_value.number_float : nullptr;
11961  }
11962 
11974  template<typename ReferenceType, typename ThisType>
11975  static ReferenceType get_ref_impl(ThisType& obj)
11976  {
11977  // delegate the call to get_ptr<>()
11978  auto ptr = obj.template get_ptr<typename std::add_pointer<ReferenceType>::type>();
11979 
11980  if (JSON_LIKELY(ptr != nullptr))
11981  {
11982  return *ptr;
11983  }
11984 
11985  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(303, "incompatible ReferenceType for get_ref, actual type is " + std::string(obj.type_name())));
11986  }
11987 
11988  public:
11992 
12007  template<typename BasicJsonType, detail::enable_if_t<
12008  std::is_same<typename std::remove_const<BasicJsonType>::type, basic_json_t>::value,
12009  int> = 0>
12010  basic_json get() const
12011  {
12012  return *this;
12013  }
12014 
12054  template<typename ValueTypeCV, typename ValueType = detail::uncvref_t<ValueTypeCV>,
12055  detail::enable_if_t <
12056  not std::is_same<basic_json_t, ValueType>::value and
12057  detail::has_from_json<basic_json_t, ValueType>::value and
12058  not detail::has_non_default_from_json<basic_json_t, ValueType>::value,
12059  int> = 0>
12060  ValueType get() const noexcept(noexcept(
12061  JSONSerializer<ValueType>::from_json(std::declval<const basic_json_t&>(), std::declval<ValueType&>())))
12062  {
12063  // we cannot static_assert on ValueTypeCV being non-const, because
12064  // there is support for get<const basic_json_t>(), which is why we
12065  // still need the uncvref
12066  static_assert(not std::is_reference<ValueTypeCV>::value,
12067  "get() cannot be used with reference types, you might want to use get_ref()");
12068  static_assert(std::is_default_constructible<ValueType>::value,
12069  "types must be DefaultConstructible when used with get()");
12070 
12071  ValueType ret;
12072  JSONSerializer<ValueType>::from_json(*this, ret);
12073  return ret;
12074  }
12075 
12107  template<typename ValueTypeCV, typename ValueType = detail::uncvref_t<ValueTypeCV>,
12108  detail::enable_if_t<not std::is_same<basic_json_t, ValueType>::value and
12109  detail::has_non_default_from_json<basic_json_t, ValueType>::value,
12110  int> = 0>
12111  ValueType get() const noexcept(noexcept(
12112  JSONSerializer<ValueTypeCV>::from_json(std::declval<const basic_json_t&>())))
12113  {
12114  static_assert(not std::is_reference<ValueTypeCV>::value,
12115  "get() cannot be used with reference types, you might want to use get_ref()");
12116  return JSONSerializer<ValueTypeCV>::from_json(*this);
12117  }
12118 
12146  template<typename PointerType, typename std::enable_if<
12147  std::is_pointer<PointerType>::value, int>::type = 0>
12148  PointerType get() noexcept
12149  {
12150  // delegate the call to get_ptr
12151  return get_ptr<PointerType>();
12152  }
12153 
12158  template<typename PointerType, typename std::enable_if<
12159  std::is_pointer<PointerType>::value, int>::type = 0>
12160  constexpr const PointerType get() const noexcept
12161  {
12162  // delegate the call to get_ptr
12163  return get_ptr<PointerType>();
12164  }
12165 
12192  template<typename PointerType, typename std::enable_if<
12193  std::is_pointer<PointerType>::value, int>::type = 0>
12194  PointerType get_ptr() noexcept
12195  {
12196  // get the type of the PointerType (remove pointer and const)
12197  using pointee_t = typename std::remove_const<typename
12198  std::remove_pointer<typename
12199  std::remove_const<PointerType>::type>::type>::type;
12200  // make sure the type matches the allowed types
12201  static_assert(
12202  std::is_same<object_t, pointee_t>::value
12203  or std::is_same<array_t, pointee_t>::value
12204  or std::is_same<string_t, pointee_t>::value
12205  or std::is_same<boolean_t, pointee_t>::value
12206  or std::is_same<number_integer_t, pointee_t>::value
12207  or std::is_same<number_unsigned_t, pointee_t>::value
12208  or std::is_same<number_float_t, pointee_t>::value
12209  , "incompatible pointer type");
12210 
12211  // delegate the call to get_impl_ptr<>()
12212  return get_impl_ptr(static_cast<PointerType>(nullptr));
12213  }
12214 
12219  template<typename PointerType, typename std::enable_if<
12220  std::is_pointer<PointerType>::value and
12221  std::is_const<typename std::remove_pointer<PointerType>::type>::value, int>::type = 0>
12222  constexpr const PointerType get_ptr() const noexcept
12223  {
12224  // get the type of the PointerType (remove pointer and const)
12225  using pointee_t = typename std::remove_const<typename
12226  std::remove_pointer<typename
12227  std::remove_const<PointerType>::type>::type>::type;
12228  // make sure the type matches the allowed types
12229  static_assert(
12230  std::is_same<object_t, pointee_t>::value
12231  or std::is_same<array_t, pointee_t>::value
12232  or std::is_same<string_t, pointee_t>::value
12233  or std::is_same<boolean_t, pointee_t>::value
12234  or std::is_same<number_integer_t, pointee_t>::value
12235  or std::is_same<number_unsigned_t, pointee_t>::value
12236  or std::is_same<number_float_t, pointee_t>::value
12237  , "incompatible pointer type");
12238 
12239  // delegate the call to get_impl_ptr<>() const
12240  return get_impl_ptr(static_cast<PointerType>(nullptr));
12241  }
12242 
12269  template<typename ReferenceType, typename std::enable_if<
12270  std::is_reference<ReferenceType>::value, int>::type = 0>
12271  ReferenceType get_ref()
12272  {
12273  // delegate call to get_ref_impl
12274  return get_ref_impl<ReferenceType>(*this);
12275  }
12276 
12281  template<typename ReferenceType, typename std::enable_if<
12282  std::is_reference<ReferenceType>::value and
12283  std::is_const<typename std::remove_reference<ReferenceType>::type>::value, int>::type = 0>
12284  ReferenceType get_ref() const
12285  {
12286  // delegate call to get_ref_impl
12287  return get_ref_impl<ReferenceType>(*this);
12288  }
12289 
12319  template < typename ValueType, typename std::enable_if <
12320  not std::is_pointer<ValueType>::value and
12321  not std::is_same<ValueType, detail::json_ref<basic_json>>::value and
12322  not std::is_same<ValueType, typename string_t::value_type>::value
12323 #ifndef _MSC_VER // fix for issue #167 operator<< ambiguity under VS2015
12324  and not std::is_same<ValueType, std::initializer_list<typename string_t::value_type>>::value
12325 #endif
12326 #if defined(JSON_HAS_CPP_17)
12327  and not std::is_same<ValueType, typename std::string_view>::value
12328 #endif
12329  , int >::type = 0 >
12330  operator ValueType() const
12331  {
12332  // delegate the call to get<>() const
12333  return get<ValueType>();
12334  }
12335 
12337 
12338 
12340  // element access //
12342 
12346 
12373  reference at(size_type idx)
12374  {
12375  // at only works for arrays
12376  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_array()))
12377  {
12378  JSON_TRY
12379  {
12380  return m_value.array->at(idx);
12381  }
12382  JSON_CATCH (std::out_of_range&)
12383  {
12384  // create better exception explanation
12385  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(401, "array index " + std::to_string(idx) + " is out of range"));
12386  }
12387  }
12388  else
12389  {
12390  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(304, "cannot use at() with " + std::string(type_name())));
12391  }
12392  }
12393 
12420  const_reference at(size_type idx) const
12421  {
12422  // at only works for arrays
12423  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_array()))
12424  {
12425  JSON_TRY
12426  {
12427  return m_value.array->at(idx);
12428  }
12429  JSON_CATCH (std::out_of_range&)
12430  {
12431  // create better exception explanation
12432  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(401, "array index " + std::to_string(idx) + " is out of range"));
12433  }
12434  }
12435  else
12436  {
12437  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(304, "cannot use at() with " + std::string(type_name())));
12438  }
12439  }
12440 
12471  reference at(const typename object_t::key_type& key)
12472  {
12473  // at only works for objects
12474  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_object()))
12475  {
12476  JSON_TRY
12477  {
12478  return m_value.object->at(key);
12479  }
12480  JSON_CATCH (std::out_of_range&)
12481  {
12482  // create better exception explanation
12483  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(403, "key '" + key + "' not found"));
12484  }
12485  }
12486  else
12487  {
12488  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(304, "cannot use at() with " + std::string(type_name())));
12489  }
12490  }
12491 
12522  const_reference at(const typename object_t::key_type& key) const
12523  {
12524  // at only works for objects
12525  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_object()))
12526  {
12527  JSON_TRY
12528  {
12529  return m_value.object->at(key);
12530  }
12531  JSON_CATCH (std::out_of_range&)
12532  {
12533  // create better exception explanation
12534  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(403, "key '" + key + "' not found"));
12535  }
12536  }
12537  else
12538  {
12539  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(304, "cannot use at() with " + std::string(type_name())));
12540  }
12541  }
12542 
12568  reference operator[](size_type idx)
12569  {
12570  // implicitly convert null value to an empty array
12571  if (is_null())
12572  {
12573  m_type = value_t::array;
12574  m_value.array = create<array_t>();
12575  assert_invariant();
12576  }
12577 
12578  // operator[] only works for arrays
12579  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_array()))
12580  {
12581  // fill up array with null values if given idx is outside range
12582  if (idx >= m_value.array->size())
12583  {
12584  m_value.array->insert(m_value.array->end(),
12585  idx - m_value.array->size() + 1,
12586  basic_json());
12587  }
12588 
12589  return m_value.array->operator[](idx);
12590  }
12591 
12592  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(305, "cannot use operator[] with " + std::string(type_name())));
12593  }
12594 
12614  const_reference operator[](size_type idx) const
12615  {
12616  // const operator[] only works for arrays
12617  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_array()))
12618  {
12619  return m_value.array->operator[](idx);
12620  }
12621 
12622  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(305, "cannot use operator[] with " + std::string(type_name())));
12623  }
12624 
12652  reference operator[](const typename object_t::key_type& key)
12653  {
12654  // implicitly convert null value to an empty object
12655  if (is_null())
12656  {
12657  m_type = value_t::object;
12658  m_value.object = create<object_t>();
12659  assert_invariant();
12660  }
12661 
12662  // operator[] only works for objects
12663  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_object()))
12664  {
12665  return m_value.object->operator[](key);
12666  }
12667 
12668  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(305, "cannot use operator[] with " + std::string(type_name())));
12669  }
12670 
12701  const_reference operator[](const typename object_t::key_type& key) const
12702  {
12703  // const operator[] only works for objects
12704  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_object()))
12705  {
12706  assert(m_value.object->find(key) != m_value.object->end());
12707  return m_value.object->find(key)->second;
12708  }
12709 
12710  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(305, "cannot use operator[] with " + std::string(type_name())));
12711  }
12712 
12740  template<typename T>
12741  reference operator[](T* key)
12742  {
12743  // implicitly convert null to object
12744  if (is_null())
12745  {
12746  m_type = value_t::object;
12747  m_value = value_t::object;
12748  assert_invariant();
12749  }
12750 
12751  // at only works for objects
12752  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_object()))
12753  {
12754  return m_value.object->operator[](key);
12755  }
12756 
12757  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(305, "cannot use operator[] with " + std::string(type_name())));
12758  }
12759 
12790  template<typename T>
12791  const_reference operator[](T* key) const
12792  {
12793  // at only works for objects
12794  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_object()))
12795  {
12796  assert(m_value.object->find(key) != m_value.object->end());
12797  return m_value.object->find(key)->second;
12798  }
12799 
12800  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(305, "cannot use operator[] with " + std::string(type_name())));
12801  }
12802 
12851  template<class ValueType, typename std::enable_if<
12852  std::is_convertible<basic_json_t, ValueType>::value, int>::type = 0>
12853  ValueType value(const typename object_t::key_type& key, const ValueType& default_value) const
12854  {
12855  // at only works for objects
12856  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_object()))
12857  {
12858  // if key is found, return value and given default value otherwise
12859  const auto it = find(key);
12860  if (it != end())
12861  {
12862  return *it;
12863  }
12864 
12865  return default_value;
12866  }
12867 
12868  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(306, "cannot use value() with " + std::string(type_name())));
12869  }
12870 
12875  string_t value(const typename object_t::key_type& key, const char* default_value) const
12876  {
12877  return value(key, string_t(default_value));
12878  }
12879 
12921  template<class ValueType, typename std::enable_if<
12922  std::is_convertible<basic_json_t, ValueType>::value, int>::type = 0>
12923  ValueType value(const json_pointer& ptr, const ValueType& default_value) const
12924  {
12925  // at only works for objects
12926  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_object()))
12927  {
12928  // if pointer resolves a value, return it or use default value
12929  JSON_TRY
12930  {
12931  return ptr.get_checked(this);
12932  }
12933  JSON_CATCH (out_of_range&)
12934  {
12935  return default_value;
12936  }
12937  }
12938 
12939  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(306, "cannot use value() with " + std::string(type_name())));
12940  }
12941 
12946  string_t value(const json_pointer& ptr, const char* default_value) const
12947  {
12948  return value(ptr, string_t(default_value));
12949  }
12950 
12976  reference front()
12977  {
12978  return *begin();
12979  }
12980 
12984  const_reference front() const
12985  {
12986  return *cbegin();
12987  }
12988 
13020  reference back()
13021  {
13022  auto tmp = end();
13023  --tmp;
13024  return *tmp;
13025  }
13026 
13030  const_reference back() const
13031  {
13032  auto tmp = cend();
13033  --tmp;
13034  return *tmp;
13035  }
13036 
13083  template<class IteratorType, typename std::enable_if<
13084  std::is_same<IteratorType, typename basic_json_t::iterator>::value or
13085  std::is_same<IteratorType, typename basic_json_t::const_iterator>::value, int>::type
13086  = 0>
13087  IteratorType erase(IteratorType pos)
13088  {
13089  // make sure iterator fits the current value
13090  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(this != pos.m_object))
13091  {
13092  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(202, "iterator does not fit current value"));
13093  }
13094 
13095  IteratorType result = end();
13096 
13097  switch (m_type)
13098  {
13099  case value_t::boolean:
13100  case value_t::number_float:
13101  case value_t::number_integer:
13102  case value_t::number_unsigned:
13103  case value_t::string:
13104  {
13105  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not pos.m_it.primitive_iterator.is_begin()))
13106  {
13107  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(205, "iterator out of range"));
13108  }
13109 
13110  if (is_string())
13111  {
13112  AllocatorType<string_t> alloc;
13113  std::allocator_traits<decltype(alloc)>::destroy(alloc, m_value.string);
13114  std::allocator_traits<decltype(alloc)>::deallocate(alloc, m_value.string, 1);
13115  m_value.string = nullptr;
13116  }
13117 
13118  m_type = value_t::null;
13119  assert_invariant();
13120  break;
13121  }
13122 
13123  case value_t::object:
13124  {
13125  result.m_it.object_iterator = m_value.object->erase(pos.m_it.object_iterator);
13126  break;
13127  }
13128 
13129  case value_t::array:
13130  {
13131  result.m_it.array_iterator = m_value.array->erase(pos.m_it.array_iterator);
13132  break;
13133  }
13134 
13135  default:
13136  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(307, "cannot use erase() with " + std::string(type_name())));
13137  }
13138 
13139  return result;
13140  }
13141 
13188  template<class IteratorType, typename std::enable_if<
13189  std::is_same<IteratorType, typename basic_json_t::iterator>::value or
13190  std::is_same<IteratorType, typename basic_json_t::const_iterator>::value, int>::type
13191  = 0>
13192  IteratorType erase(IteratorType first, IteratorType last)
13193  {
13194  // make sure iterator fits the current value
13195  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(this != first.m_object or this != last.m_object))
13196  {
13197  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(203, "iterators do not fit current value"));
13198  }
13199 
13200  IteratorType result = end();
13201 
13202  switch (m_type)
13203  {
13204  case value_t::boolean:
13205  case value_t::number_float:
13206  case value_t::number_integer:
13207  case value_t::number_unsigned:
13208  case value_t::string:
13209  {
13210  if (JSON_LIKELY(not first.m_it.primitive_iterator.is_begin()
13211  or not last.m_it.primitive_iterator.is_end()))
13212  {
13213  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(204, "iterators out of range"));
13214  }
13215 
13216  if (is_string())
13217  {
13218  AllocatorType<string_t> alloc;
13219  std::allocator_traits<decltype(alloc)>::destroy(alloc, m_value.string);
13220  std::allocator_traits<decltype(alloc)>::deallocate(alloc, m_value.string, 1);
13221  m_value.string = nullptr;
13222  }
13223 
13224  m_type = value_t::null;
13225  assert_invariant();
13226  break;
13227  }
13228 
13229  case value_t::object:
13230  {
13231  result.m_it.object_iterator = m_value.object->erase(first.m_it.object_iterator,
13232  last.m_it.object_iterator);
13233  break;
13234  }
13235 
13236  case value_t::array:
13237  {
13238  result.m_it.array_iterator = m_value.array->erase(first.m_it.array_iterator,
13239  last.m_it.array_iterator);
13240  break;
13241  }
13242 
13243  default:
13244  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(307, "cannot use erase() with " + std::string(type_name())));
13245  }
13246 
13247  return result;
13248  }
13249 
13279  size_type erase(const typename object_t::key_type& key)
13280  {
13281  // this erase only works for objects
13282  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_object()))
13283  {
13284  return m_value.object->erase(key);
13285  }
13286 
13287  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(307, "cannot use erase() with " + std::string(type_name())));
13288  }
13289 
13314  void erase(const size_type idx)
13315  {
13316  // this erase only works for arrays
13317  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_array()))
13318  {
13319  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(idx >= size()))
13320  {
13321  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(401, "array index " + std::to_string(idx) + " is out of range"));
13322  }
13323 
13324  m_value.array->erase(m_value.array->begin() + static_cast<difference_type>(idx));
13325  }
13326  else
13327  {
13328  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(307, "cannot use erase() with " + std::string(type_name())));
13329  }
13330  }
13331 
13333 
13334 
13336  // lookup //
13338 
13341 
13364  template<typename KeyT>
13365  iterator find(KeyT&& key)
13366  {
13367  auto result = end();
13368 
13369  if (is_object())
13370  {
13371  result.m_it.object_iterator = m_value.object->find(std::forward<KeyT>(key));
13372  }
13373 
13374  return result;
13375  }
13376 
13381  template<typename KeyT>
13382  const_iterator find(KeyT&& key) const
13383  {
13384  auto result = cend();
13385 
13386  if (is_object())
13387  {
13388  result.m_it.object_iterator = m_value.object->find(std::forward<KeyT>(key));
13389  }
13390 
13391  return result;
13392  }
13393 
13415  template<typename KeyT>
13416  size_type count(KeyT&& key) const
13417  {
13418  // return 0 for all nonobject types
13419  return is_object() ? m_value.object->count(std::forward<KeyT>(key)) : 0;
13420  }
13421 
13423 
13424 
13426  // iterators //
13428 
13431 
13456  iterator begin() noexcept
13457  {
13458  iterator result(this);
13459  result.set_begin();
13460  return result;
13461  }
13462 
13466  const_iterator begin() const noexcept
13467  {
13468  return cbegin();
13469  }
13470 
13496  const_iterator cbegin() const noexcept
13497  {
13498  const_iterator result(this);
13499  result.set_begin();
13500  return result;
13501  }
13502 
13527  iterator end() noexcept
13528  {
13529  iterator result(this);
13530  result.set_end();
13531  return result;
13532  }
13533 
13537  const_iterator end() const noexcept
13538  {
13539  return cend();
13540  }
13541 
13567  const_iterator cend() const noexcept
13568  {
13569  const_iterator result(this);
13570  result.set_end();
13571  return result;
13572  }
13573 
13597  reverse_iterator rbegin() noexcept
13598  {
13599  return reverse_iterator(end());
13600  }
13601 
13605  const_reverse_iterator rbegin() const noexcept
13606  {
13607  return crbegin();
13608  }
13609 
13634  reverse_iterator rend() noexcept
13635  {
13636  return reverse_iterator(begin());
13637  }
13638 
13642  const_reverse_iterator rend() const noexcept
13643  {
13644  return crend();
13645  }
13646 
13671  const_reverse_iterator crbegin() const noexcept
13672  {
13673  return const_reverse_iterator(cend());
13674  }
13675 
13700  const_reverse_iterator crend() const noexcept
13701  {
13702  return const_reverse_iterator(cbegin());
13703  }
13704 
13705  public:
13763  JSON_DEPRECATED
13764  static iteration_proxy<iterator> iterator_wrapper(reference ref) noexcept
13765  {
13766  return ref.items();
13767  }
13768 
13772  JSON_DEPRECATED
13773  static iteration_proxy<const_iterator> iterator_wrapper(const_reference ref) noexcept
13774  {
13775  return ref.items();
13776  }
13777 
13830  iteration_proxy<iterator> items() noexcept
13831  {
13832  return iteration_proxy<iterator>(*this);
13833  }
13834 
13838  iteration_proxy<const_iterator> items() const noexcept
13839  {
13840  return iteration_proxy<const_iterator>(*this);
13841  }
13842 
13844 
13845 
13847  // capacity //
13849 
13852 
13894  bool empty() const noexcept
13895  {
13896  switch (m_type)
13897  {
13898  case value_t::null:
13899  {
13900  // null values are empty
13901  return true;
13902  }
13903 
13904  case value_t::array:
13905  {
13906  // delegate call to array_t::empty()
13907  return m_value.array->empty();
13908  }
13909 
13910  case value_t::object:
13911  {
13912  // delegate call to object_t::empty()
13913  return m_value.object->empty();
13914  }
13915 
13916  default:
13917  {
13918  // all other types are nonempty
13919  return false;
13920  }
13921  }
13922  }
13923 
13966  size_type size() const noexcept
13967  {
13968  switch (m_type)
13969  {
13970  case value_t::null:
13971  {
13972  // null values are empty
13973  return 0;
13974  }
13975 
13976  case value_t::array:
13977  {
13978  // delegate call to array_t::size()
13979  return m_value.array->size();
13980  }
13981 
13982  case value_t::object:
13983  {
13984  // delegate call to object_t::size()
13985  return m_value.object->size();
13986  }
13987 
13988  default:
13989  {
13990  // all other types have size 1
13991  return 1;
13992  }
13993  }
13994  }
13995 
14036  size_type max_size() const noexcept
14037  {
14038  switch (m_type)
14039  {
14040  case value_t::array:
14041  {
14042  // delegate call to array_t::max_size()
14043  return m_value.array->max_size();
14044  }
14045 
14046  case value_t::object:
14047  {
14048  // delegate call to object_t::max_size()
14049  return m_value.object->max_size();
14050  }
14051 
14052  default:
14053  {
14054  // all other types have max_size() == size()
14055  return size();
14056  }
14057  }
14058  }
14059 
14061 
14062 
14064  // modifiers //
14066 
14069 
14106  void clear() noexcept
14107  {
14108  switch (m_type)
14109  {
14110  case value_t::number_integer:
14111  {
14112  m_value.number_integer = 0;
14113  break;
14114  }
14115 
14116  case value_t::number_unsigned:
14117  {
14118  m_value.number_unsigned = 0;
14119  break;
14120  }
14121 
14122  case value_t::number_float:
14123  {
14124  m_value.number_float = 0.0;
14125  break;
14126  }
14127 
14128  case value_t::boolean:
14129  {
14130  m_value.boolean = false;
14131  break;
14132  }
14133 
14134  case value_t::string:
14135  {
14136  m_value.string->clear();
14137  break;
14138  }
14139 
14140  case value_t::array:
14141  {
14142  m_value.array->clear();
14143  break;
14144  }
14145 
14146  case value_t::object:
14147  {
14148  m_value.object->clear();
14149  break;
14150  }
14151 
14152  default:
14153  break;
14154  }
14155  }
14156 
14177  void push_back(basic_json&& val)
14178  {
14179  // push_back only works for null objects or arrays
14180  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not(is_null() or is_array())))
14181  {
14182  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(308, "cannot use push_back() with " + std::string(type_name())));
14183  }
14184 
14185  // transform null object into an array
14186  if (is_null())
14187  {
14188  m_type = value_t::array;
14189  m_value = value_t::array;
14190  assert_invariant();
14191  }
14192 
14193  // add element to array (move semantics)
14194  m_value.array->push_back(std::move(val));
14195  // invalidate object
14196  val.m_type = value_t::null;
14197  }
14198 
14203  reference operator+=(basic_json&& val)
14204  {
14205  push_back(std::move(val));
14206  return *this;
14207  }
14208 
14213  void push_back(const basic_json& val)
14214  {
14215  // push_back only works for null objects or arrays
14216  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not(is_null() or is_array())))
14217  {
14218  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(308, "cannot use push_back() with " + std::string(type_name())));
14219  }
14220 
14221  // transform null object into an array
14222  if (is_null())
14223  {
14224  m_type = value_t::array;
14225  m_value = value_t::array;
14226  assert_invariant();
14227  }
14228 
14229  // add element to array
14230  m_value.array->push_back(val);
14231  }
14232 
14237  reference operator+=(const basic_json& val)
14238  {
14239  push_back(val);
14240  return *this;
14241  }
14242 
14263  void push_back(const typename object_t::value_type& val)
14264  {
14265  // push_back only works for null objects or objects
14266  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not(is_null() or is_object())))
14267  {
14268  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(308, "cannot use push_back() with " + std::string(type_name())));
14269  }
14270 
14271  // transform null object into an object
14272  if (is_null())
14273  {
14274  m_type = value_t::object;
14275  m_value = value_t::object;
14276  assert_invariant();
14277  }
14278 
14279  // add element to array
14280  m_value.object->insert(val);
14281  }
14282 
14287  reference operator+=(const typename object_t::value_type& val)
14288  {
14289  push_back(val);
14290  return *this;
14291  }
14292 
14318  void push_back(initializer_list_t init)
14319  {
14320  if (is_object() and init.size() == 2 and (*init.begin())->is_string())
14321  {
14322  basic_json&& key = init.begin()->moved_or_copied();
14323  push_back(typename object_t::value_type(
14324  std::move(key.get_ref<string_t&>()), (init.begin() + 1)->moved_or_copied()));
14325  }
14326  else
14327  {
14328  push_back(basic_json(init));
14329  }
14330  }
14331 
14336  reference operator+=(initializer_list_t init)
14337  {
14338  push_back(init);
14339  return *this;
14340  }
14341 
14363  template<class... Args>
14364  void emplace_back(Args&& ... args)
14365  {
14366  // emplace_back only works for null objects or arrays
14367  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not(is_null() or is_array())))
14368  {
14369  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(311, "cannot use emplace_back() with " + std::string(type_name())));
14370  }
14371 
14372  // transform null object into an array
14373  if (is_null())
14374  {
14375  m_type = value_t::array;
14376  m_value = value_t::array;
14377  assert_invariant();
14378  }
14379 
14380  // add element to array (perfect forwarding)
14381  m_value.array->emplace_back(std::forward<Args>(args)...);
14382  }
14383 
14411  template<class... Args>
14412  std::pair<iterator, bool> emplace(Args&& ... args)
14413  {
14414  // emplace only works for null objects or arrays
14415  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not(is_null() or is_object())))
14416  {
14417  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(311, "cannot use emplace() with " + std::string(type_name())));
14418  }
14419 
14420  // transform null object into an object
14421  if (is_null())
14422  {
14423  m_type = value_t::object;
14424  m_value = value_t::object;
14425  assert_invariant();
14426  }
14427 
14428  // add element to array (perfect forwarding)
14429  auto res = m_value.object->emplace(std::forward<Args>(args)...);
14430  // create result iterator and set iterator to the result of emplace
14431  auto it = begin();
14432  it.m_it.object_iterator = res.first;
14433 
14434  // return pair of iterator and boolean
14435  return {it, res.second};
14436  }
14437 
14460  iterator insert(const_iterator pos, const basic_json& val)
14461  {
14462  // insert only works for arrays
14463  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_array()))
14464  {
14465  // check if iterator pos fits to this JSON value
14466  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(pos.m_object != this))
14467  {
14468  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(202, "iterator does not fit current value"));
14469  }
14470 
14471  // insert to array and return iterator
14472  iterator result(this);
14473  result.m_it.array_iterator = m_value.array->insert(pos.m_it.array_iterator, val);
14474  return result;
14475  }
14476 
14477  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(309, "cannot use insert() with " + std::string(type_name())));
14478  }
14479 
14484  iterator insert(const_iterator pos, basic_json&& val)
14485  {
14486  return insert(pos, val);
14487  }
14488 
14513  iterator insert(const_iterator pos, size_type cnt, const basic_json& val)
14514  {
14515  // insert only works for arrays
14516  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_array()))
14517  {
14518  // check if iterator pos fits to this JSON value
14519  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(pos.m_object != this))
14520  {
14521  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(202, "iterator does not fit current value"));
14522  }
14523 
14524  // insert to array and return iterator
14525  iterator result(this);
14526  result.m_it.array_iterator = m_value.array->insert(pos.m_it.array_iterator, cnt, val);
14527  return result;
14528  }
14529 
14530  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(309, "cannot use insert() with " + std::string(type_name())));
14531  }
14532 
14563  iterator insert(const_iterator pos, const_iterator first, const_iterator last)
14564  {
14565  // insert only works for arrays
14566  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not is_array()))
14567  {
14568  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(309, "cannot use insert() with " + std::string(type_name())));
14569  }
14570 
14571  // check if iterator pos fits to this JSON value
14572  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(pos.m_object != this))
14573  {
14574  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(202, "iterator does not fit current value"));
14575  }
14576 
14577  // check if range iterators belong to the same JSON object
14578  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(first.m_object != last.m_object))
14579  {
14580  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(210, "iterators do not fit"));
14581  }
14582 
14583  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(first.m_object == this))
14584  {
14585  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(211, "passed iterators may not belong to container"));
14586  }
14587 
14588  // insert to array and return iterator
14589  iterator result(this);
14590  result.m_it.array_iterator = m_value.array->insert(
14591  pos.m_it.array_iterator,
14592  first.m_it.array_iterator,
14593  last.m_it.array_iterator);
14594  return result;
14595  }
14596 
14621  iterator insert(const_iterator pos, initializer_list_t ilist)
14622  {
14623  // insert only works for arrays
14624  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not is_array()))
14625  {
14626  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(309, "cannot use insert() with " + std::string(type_name())));
14627  }
14628 
14629  // check if iterator pos fits to this JSON value
14630  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(pos.m_object != this))
14631  {
14632  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(202, "iterator does not fit current value"));
14633  }
14634 
14635  // insert to array and return iterator
14636  iterator result(this);
14637  result.m_it.array_iterator = m_value.array->insert(pos.m_it.array_iterator, ilist.begin(), ilist.end());
14638  return result;
14639  }
14640 
14664  void insert(const_iterator first, const_iterator last)
14665  {
14666  // insert only works for objects
14667  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not is_object()))
14668  {
14669  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(309, "cannot use insert() with " + std::string(type_name())));
14670  }
14671 
14672  // check if range iterators belong to the same JSON object
14673  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(first.m_object != last.m_object))
14674  {
14675  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(210, "iterators do not fit"));
14676  }
14677 
14678  // passed iterators must belong to objects
14679  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not first.m_object->is_object()))
14680  {
14681  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(202, "iterators first and last must point to objects"));
14682  }
14683 
14684  m_value.object->insert(first.m_it.object_iterator, last.m_it.object_iterator);
14685  }
14686 
14706  void update(const_reference j)
14707  {
14708  // implicitly convert null value to an empty object
14709  if (is_null())
14710  {
14711  m_type = value_t::object;
14712  m_value.object = create<object_t>();
14713  assert_invariant();
14714  }
14715 
14716  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not is_object()))
14717  {
14718  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(312, "cannot use update() with " + std::string(type_name())));
14719  }
14720  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not j.is_object()))
14721  {
14722  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(312, "cannot use update() with " + std::string(j.type_name())));
14723  }
14724 
14725  for (auto it = j.cbegin(); it != j.cend(); ++it)
14726  {
14727  m_value.object->operator[](it.key()) = it.value();
14728  }
14729  }
14730 
14757  void update(const_iterator first, const_iterator last)
14758  {
14759  // implicitly convert null value to an empty object
14760  if (is_null())
14761  {
14762  m_type = value_t::object;
14763  m_value.object = create<object_t>();
14764  assert_invariant();
14765  }
14766 
14767  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not is_object()))
14768  {
14769  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(312, "cannot use update() with " + std::string(type_name())));
14770  }
14771 
14772  // check if range iterators belong to the same JSON object
14773  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(first.m_object != last.m_object))
14774  {
14775  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(210, "iterators do not fit"));
14776  }
14777 
14778  // passed iterators must belong to objects
14779  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not first.m_object->is_object()
14780  or not first.m_object->is_object()))
14781  {
14782  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(202, "iterators first and last must point to objects"));
14783  }
14784 
14785  for (auto it = first; it != last; ++it)
14786  {
14787  m_value.object->operator[](it.key()) = it.value();
14788  }
14789  }
14790 
14808  void swap(reference other) noexcept (
14809  std::is_nothrow_move_constructible<value_t>::value and
14810  std::is_nothrow_move_assignable<value_t>::value and
14811  std::is_nothrow_move_constructible<json_value>::value and
14812  std::is_nothrow_move_assignable<json_value>::value
14813  )
14814  {
14815  std::swap(m_type, other.m_type);
14816  std::swap(m_value, other.m_value);
14817  assert_invariant();
14818  }
14819 
14840  void swap(array_t& other)
14841  {
14842  // swap only works for arrays
14843  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_array()))
14844  {
14845  std::swap(*(m_value.array), other);
14846  }
14847  else
14848  {
14849  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(310, "cannot use swap() with " + std::string(type_name())));
14850  }
14851  }
14852 
14873  void swap(object_t& other)
14874  {
14875  // swap only works for objects
14876  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_object()))
14877  {
14878  std::swap(*(m_value.object), other);
14879  }
14880  else
14881  {
14882  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(310, "cannot use swap() with " + std::string(type_name())));
14883  }
14884  }
14885 
14906  void swap(string_t& other)
14907  {
14908  // swap only works for strings
14909  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_string()))
14910  {
14911  std::swap(*(m_value.string), other);
14912  }
14913  else
14914  {
14915  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(310, "cannot use swap() with " + std::string(type_name())));
14916  }
14917  }
14918 
14920 
14921  public:
14923  // lexicographical comparison operators //
14925 
14928 
14968  friend bool operator==(const_reference lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
14969  {
14970  const auto lhs_type = lhs.type();
14971  const auto rhs_type = rhs.type();
14972 
14973  if (lhs_type == rhs_type)
14974  {
14975  switch (lhs_type)
14976  {
14977  case value_t::array:
14978  return (*lhs.m_value.array == *rhs.m_value.array);
14979 
14980  case value_t::object:
14981  return (*lhs.m_value.object == *rhs.m_value.object);
14982 
14983  case value_t::null:
14984  return true;
14985 
14986  case value_t::string:
14987  return (*lhs.m_value.string == *rhs.m_value.string);
14988 
14989  case value_t::boolean:
14990  return (lhs.m_value.boolean == rhs.m_value.boolean);
14991 
14992  case value_t::number_integer:
14993  return (lhs.m_value.number_integer == rhs.m_value.number_integer);
14994 
14995  case value_t::number_unsigned:
14996  return (lhs.m_value.number_unsigned == rhs.m_value.number_unsigned);
14997 
14998  case value_t::number_float:
14999  return (lhs.m_value.number_float == rhs.m_value.number_float);
15000 
15001  default:
15002  return false;
15003  }
15004  }
15005  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_integer and rhs_type == value_t::number_float)
15006  {
15007  return (static_cast<number_float_t>(lhs.m_value.number_integer) == rhs.m_value.number_float);
15008  }
15009  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_float and rhs_type == value_t::number_integer)
15010  {
15011  return (lhs.m_value.number_float == static_cast<number_float_t>(rhs.m_value.number_integer));
15012  }
15013  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_unsigned and rhs_type == value_t::number_float)
15014  {
15015  return (static_cast<number_float_t>(lhs.m_value.number_unsigned) == rhs.m_value.number_float);
15016  }
15017  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_float and rhs_type == value_t::number_unsigned)
15018  {
15019  return (lhs.m_value.number_float == static_cast<number_float_t>(rhs.m_value.number_unsigned));
15020  }
15021  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_unsigned and rhs_type == value_t::number_integer)
15022  {
15023  return (static_cast<number_integer_t>(lhs.m_value.number_unsigned) == rhs.m_value.number_integer);
15024  }
15025  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_integer and rhs_type == value_t::number_unsigned)
15026  {
15027  return (lhs.m_value.number_integer == static_cast<number_integer_t>(rhs.m_value.number_unsigned));
15028  }
15029 
15030  return false;
15031  }
15032 
15037  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
15038  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
15039  friend bool operator==(const_reference lhs, const ScalarType rhs) noexcept
15040  {
15041  return (lhs == basic_json(rhs));
15042  }
15043 
15048  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
15049  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
15050  friend bool operator==(const ScalarType lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
15051  {
15052  return (basic_json(lhs) == rhs);
15053  }
15054 
15073  friend bool operator!=(const_reference lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
15074  {
15075  return not (lhs == rhs);
15076  }
15077 
15082  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
15083  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
15084  friend bool operator!=(const_reference lhs, const ScalarType rhs) noexcept
15085  {
15086  return (lhs != basic_json(rhs));
15087  }
15088 
15093  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
15094  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
15095  friend bool operator!=(const ScalarType lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
15096  {
15097  return (basic_json(lhs) != rhs);
15098  }
15099 
15126  friend bool operator<(const_reference lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
15127  {
15128  const auto lhs_type = lhs.type();
15129  const auto rhs_type = rhs.type();
15130 
15131  if (lhs_type == rhs_type)
15132  {
15133  switch (lhs_type)
15134  {
15135  case value_t::array:
15136  return (*lhs.m_value.array) < (*rhs.m_value.array);
15137 
15138  case value_t::object:
15139  return *lhs.m_value.object < *rhs.m_value.object;
15140 
15141  case value_t::null:
15142  return false;
15143 
15144  case value_t::string:
15145  return *lhs.m_value.string < *rhs.m_value.string;
15146 
15147  case value_t::boolean:
15148  return lhs.m_value.boolean < rhs.m_value.boolean;
15149 
15150  case value_t::number_integer:
15151  return lhs.m_value.number_integer < rhs.m_value.number_integer;
15152 
15153  case value_t::number_unsigned:
15154  return lhs.m_value.number_unsigned < rhs.m_value.number_unsigned;
15155 
15156  case value_t::number_float:
15157  return lhs.m_value.number_float < rhs.m_value.number_float;
15158 
15159  default:
15160  return false;
15161  }
15162  }
15163  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_integer and rhs_type == value_t::number_float)
15164  {
15165  return static_cast<number_float_t>(lhs.m_value.number_integer) < rhs.m_value.number_float;
15166  }
15167  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_float and rhs_type == value_t::number_integer)
15168  {
15169  return lhs.m_value.number_float < static_cast<number_float_t>(rhs.m_value.number_integer);
15170  }
15171  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_unsigned and rhs_type == value_t::number_float)
15172  {
15173  return static_cast<number_float_t>(lhs.m_value.number_unsigned) < rhs.m_value.number_float;
15174  }
15175  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_float and rhs_type == value_t::number_unsigned)
15176  {
15177  return lhs.m_value.number_float < static_cast<number_float_t>(rhs.m_value.number_unsigned);
15178  }
15179  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_integer and rhs_type == value_t::number_unsigned)
15180  {
15181  return lhs.m_value.number_integer < static_cast<number_integer_t>(rhs.m_value.number_unsigned);
15182  }
15183  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_unsigned and rhs_type == value_t::number_integer)
15184  {
15185  return static_cast<number_integer_t>(lhs.m_value.number_unsigned) < rhs.m_value.number_integer;
15186  }
15187 
15188  // We only reach this line if we cannot compare values. In that case,
15189  // we compare types. Note we have to call the operator explicitly,
15190  // because MSVC has problems otherwise.
15191  return operator<(lhs_type, rhs_type);
15192  }
15193 
15198  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
15199  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
15200  friend bool operator<(const_reference lhs, const ScalarType rhs) noexcept
15201  {
15202  return (lhs < basic_json(rhs));
15203  }
15204 
15209  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
15210  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
15211  friend bool operator<(const ScalarType lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
15212  {
15213  return (basic_json(lhs) < rhs);
15214  }
15215 
15235  friend bool operator<=(const_reference lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
15236  {
15237  return not (rhs < lhs);
15238  }
15239 
15244  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
15245  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
15246  friend bool operator<=(const_reference lhs, const ScalarType rhs) noexcept
15247  {
15248  return (lhs <= basic_json(rhs));
15249  }
15250 
15255  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
15256  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
15257  friend bool operator<=(const ScalarType lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
15258  {
15259  return (basic_json(lhs) <= rhs);
15260  }
15261 
15281  friend bool operator>(const_reference lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
15282  {
15283  return not (lhs <= rhs);
15284  }
15285 
15290  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
15291  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
15292  friend bool operator>(const_reference lhs, const ScalarType rhs) noexcept
15293  {
15294  return (lhs > basic_json(rhs));
15295  }
15296 
15301  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
15302  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
15303  friend bool operator>(const ScalarType lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
15304  {
15305  return (basic_json(lhs) > rhs);
15306  }
15307 
15327  friend bool operator>=(const_reference lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
15328  {
15329  return not (lhs < rhs);
15330  }
15331 
15336  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
15337  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
15338  friend bool operator>=(const_reference lhs, const ScalarType rhs) noexcept
15339  {
15340  return (lhs >= basic_json(rhs));
15341  }
15342 
15347  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
15348  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
15349  friend bool operator>=(const ScalarType lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
15350  {
15351  return (basic_json(lhs) >= rhs);
15352  }
15353 
15355 
15357  // serialization //
15359 
15362 
15394  friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& o, const basic_json& j)
15395  {
15396  // read width member and use it as indentation parameter if nonzero
15397  const bool pretty_print = (o.width() > 0);
15398  const auto indentation = (pretty_print ? o.width() : 0);
15399 
15400  // reset width to 0 for subsequent calls to this stream
15401  o.width(0);
15402 
15403  // do the actual serialization
15404  serializer s(detail::output_adapter<char>(o), o.fill());
15405  s.dump(j, pretty_print, false, static_cast<unsigned int>(indentation));
15406  return o;
15407  }
15408 
15417  JSON_DEPRECATED
15418  friend std::ostream& operator>>(const basic_json& j, std::ostream& o)
15419  {
15420  return o << j;
15421  }
15422 
15424 
15425 
15427  // deserialization //
15429 
15432 
15495  static basic_json parse(detail::input_adapter i,
15496  const parser_callback_t cb = nullptr,
15497  const bool allow_exceptions = true)
15498  {
15499  basic_json result;
15500  parser(i, cb, allow_exceptions).parse(true, result);
15501  return result;
15502  }
15503 
15507  static basic_json parse(detail::input_adapter& i,
15508  const parser_callback_t cb = nullptr,
15509  const bool allow_exceptions = true)
15510  {
15511  basic_json result;
15512  parser(i, cb, allow_exceptions).parse(true, result);
15513  return result;
15514  }
15515 
15516  static bool accept(detail::input_adapter i)
15517  {
15518  return parser(i).accept(true);
15519  }
15520 
15521  static bool accept(detail::input_adapter& i)
15522  {
15523  return parser(i).accept(true);
15524  }
15525 
15573  template<class IteratorType, typename std::enable_if<
15574  std::is_base_of<
15575  std::random_access_iterator_tag,
15576  typename std::iterator_traits<IteratorType>::iterator_category>::value, int>::type = 0>
15577  static basic_json parse(IteratorType first, IteratorType last,
15578  const parser_callback_t cb = nullptr,
15579  const bool allow_exceptions = true)
15580  {
15581  basic_json result;
15582  parser(detail::input_adapter(first, last), cb, allow_exceptions).parse(true, result);
15583  return result;
15584  }
15585 
15586  template<class IteratorType, typename std::enable_if<
15587  std::is_base_of<
15588  std::random_access_iterator_tag,
15589  typename std::iterator_traits<IteratorType>::iterator_category>::value, int>::type = 0>
15590  static bool accept(IteratorType first, IteratorType last)
15591  {
15592  return parser(detail::input_adapter(first, last)).accept(true);
15593  }
