15603  JSON_DEPRECATED
15604  friend std::istream& operator<<(basic_json& j, std::istream& i)
15605  {
15606  return operator>>(i, j);
15607  }
15608 
15634  friend std::istream& operator>>(std::istream& i, basic_json& j)
15635  {
15636  parser(detail::input_adapter(i)).parse(false, j);
15637  return i;
15638  }
15639 
15641 
15643  // convenience functions //
15645 
15676  const char* type_name() const noexcept
15677  {
15678  {
15679  switch (m_type)
15680  {
15681  case value_t::null:
15682  return "null";
15683  case value_t::object:
15684  return "object";
15685  case value_t::array:
15686  return "array";
15687  case value_t::string:
15688  return "string";
15689  case value_t::boolean:
15690  return "boolean";
15691  case value_t::discarded:
15692  return "discarded";
15693  default:
15694  return "number";
15695  }
15696  }
15697  }
15698 
15699 
15700  private:
15702  // member variables //
15704 
15706  value_t m_type = value_t::null;
15707 
15709  json_value m_value = {};
15710 
15712  // binary serialization/deserialization //
15714 
15717 
15718  public:
15807  static std::vector<uint8_t> to_cbor(const basic_json& j)
15808  {
15809  std::vector<uint8_t> result;
15810  to_cbor(j, result);
15811  return result;
15812  }
15813 
15814  static void to_cbor(const basic_json& j, detail::output_adapter<uint8_t> o)
15815  {
15816  binary_writer<uint8_t>(o).write_cbor(j);
15817  }
15818 
15819  static void to_cbor(const basic_json& j, detail::output_adapter<char> o)
15820  {
15821  binary_writer<char>(o).write_cbor(j);
15822  }
15823 
15904  static std::vector<uint8_t> to_msgpack(const basic_json& j)
15905  {
15906  std::vector<uint8_t> result;
15907  to_msgpack(j, result);
15908  return result;
15909  }
15910 
15911  static void to_msgpack(const basic_json& j, detail::output_adapter<uint8_t> o)
15912  {
15913  binary_writer<uint8_t>(o).write_msgpack(j);
15914  }
15915 
15916  static void to_msgpack(const basic_json& j, detail::output_adapter<char> o)
15917  {
15918  binary_writer<char>(o).write_msgpack(j);
15919  }
15920 
16001  static std::vector<uint8_t> to_ubjson(const basic_json& j,
16002  const bool use_size = false,
16003  const bool use_type = false)
16004  {
16005  std::vector<uint8_t> result;
16006  to_ubjson(j, result, use_size, use_type);
16007  return result;
16008  }
16009 
16010  static void to_ubjson(const basic_json& j, detail::output_adapter<uint8_t> o,
16011  const bool use_size = false, const bool use_type = false)
16012  {
16013  binary_writer<uint8_t>(o).write_ubjson(j, use_size, use_type);
16014  }
16015 
16016  static void to_ubjson(const basic_json& j, detail::output_adapter<char> o,
16017  const bool use_size = false, const bool use_type = false)
16018  {
16019  binary_writer<char>(o).write_ubjson(j, use_size, use_type);
16020  }
16021 
16115  static basic_json from_cbor(detail::input_adapter i,
16116  const bool strict = true)
16117  {
16118  return binary_reader(i).parse_cbor(strict);
16119  }
16120 
16124  template<typename A1, typename A2,
16125  detail::enable_if_t<std::is_constructible<detail::input_adapter, A1, A2>::value, int> = 0>
16126  static basic_json from_cbor(A1 && a1, A2 && a2, const bool strict = true)
16127  {
16128  return binary_reader(detail::input_adapter(std::forward<A1>(a1), std::forward<A2>(a2))).parse_cbor(strict);
16129  }
16130 
16204  static basic_json from_msgpack(detail::input_adapter i,
16205  const bool strict = true)
16206  {
16207  return binary_reader(i).parse_msgpack(strict);
16208  }
16209 
16213  template<typename A1, typename A2,
16214  detail::enable_if_t<std::is_constructible<detail::input_adapter, A1, A2>::value, int> = 0>
16215  static basic_json from_msgpack(A1 && a1, A2 && a2, const bool strict = true)
16216  {
16217  return binary_reader(detail::input_adapter(std::forward<A1>(a1), std::forward<A2>(a2))).parse_msgpack(strict);
16218  }
16219 
16273  static basic_json from_ubjson(detail::input_adapter i,
16274  const bool strict = true)
16275  {
16276  return binary_reader(i).parse_ubjson(strict);
16277  }
16278 
16279  template<typename A1, typename A2,
16280  detail::enable_if_t<std::is_constructible<detail::input_adapter, A1, A2>::value, int> = 0>
16281  static basic_json from_ubjson(A1 && a1, A2 && a2, const bool strict = true)
16282  {
16283  return binary_reader(detail::input_adapter(std::forward<A1>(a1), std::forward<A2>(a2))).parse_ubjson(strict);
16284  }
16285 
16287 
16289  // JSON Pointer support //
16291 
16294 
16328  reference operator[](const json_pointer& ptr)
16329  {
16330  return ptr.get_unchecked(this);
16331  }
16332 
16356  const_reference operator[](const json_pointer& ptr) const
16357  {
16358  return ptr.get_unchecked(this);
16359  }
16360 
16399  reference at(const json_pointer& ptr)
16400  {
16401  return ptr.get_checked(this);
16402  }
16403 
16442  const_reference at(const json_pointer& ptr) const
16443  {
16444  return ptr.get_checked(this);
16445  }
16446 
16469  basic_json flatten() const
16470  {
16471  basic_json result(value_t::object);
16472  json_pointer::flatten("", *this, result);
16473  return result;
16474  }
16475 
16506  basic_json unflatten() const
16507  {
16508  return json_pointer::unflatten(*this);
16509  }
16510 
16512 
16514  // JSON Patch functions //
16516 
16519 
16567  basic_json patch(const basic_json& json_patch) const
16568  {
16569  // make a working copy to apply the patch to
16570  basic_json result = *this;
16571 
16572  // the valid JSON Patch operations
16573  enum class patch_operations {add, remove, replace, move, copy, test, invalid};
16574 
16575  const auto get_op = [](const std::string & op)
16576  {
16577  if (op == "add")
16578  {
16579  return patch_operations::add;
16580  }
16581  if (op == "remove")
16582  {
16583  return patch_operations::remove;
16584  }
16585  if (op == "replace")
16586  {
16587  return patch_operations::replace;
16588  }
16589  if (op == "move")
16590  {
16591  return patch_operations::move;
16592  }
16593  if (op == "copy")
16594  {
16595  return patch_operations::copy;
16596  }
16597  if (op == "test")
16598  {
16599  return patch_operations::test;
16600  }
16601 
16602  return patch_operations::invalid;
16603  };
16604 
16605  // wrapper for "add" operation; add value at ptr
16606  const auto operation_add = [&result](json_pointer & ptr, basic_json val)
16607  {
16608  // adding to the root of the target document means replacing it
16609  if (ptr.is_root())
16610  {
16611  result = val;
16612  }
16613  else
16614  {
16615  // make sure the top element of the pointer exists
16616  json_pointer top_pointer = ptr.top();
16617  if (top_pointer != ptr)
16618  {
16619  result.at(top_pointer);
16620  }
16621 
16622  // get reference to parent of JSON pointer ptr
16623  const auto last_path = ptr.pop_back();
16624  basic_json& parent = result[ptr];
16625 
16626  switch (parent.m_type)
16627  {
16628  case value_t::null:
16629  case value_t::object:
16630  {
16631  // use operator[] to add value
16632  parent[last_path] = val;
16633  break;
16634  }
16635 
16636  case value_t::array:
16637  {
16638  if (last_path == "-")
16639  {
16640  // special case: append to back
16641  parent.push_back(val);
16642  }
16643  else
16644  {
16645  const auto idx = json_pointer::array_index(last_path);
16646  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(static_cast<size_type>(idx) > parent.size()))
16647  {
16648  // avoid undefined behavior
16649  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(401, "array index " + std::to_string(idx) + " is out of range"));
16650  }
16651  else
16652  {
16653  // default case: insert add offset
16654  parent.insert(parent.begin() + static_cast<difference_type>(idx), val);
16655  }
16656  }
16657  break;
16658  }
16659 
16660  default:
16661  {
16662  // if there exists a parent it cannot be primitive
16663  assert(false); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
16664  }
16665  }
16666  }
16667  };
16668 
16669  // wrapper for "remove" operation; remove value at ptr
16670  const auto operation_remove = [&result](json_pointer & ptr)
16671  {
16672  // get reference to parent of JSON pointer ptr
16673  const auto last_path = ptr.pop_back();
16674  basic_json& parent = result.at(ptr);
16675 
16676  // remove child
16677  if (parent.is_object())
16678  {
16679  // perform range check
16680  auto it = parent.find(last_path);
16681  if (JSON_LIKELY(it != parent.end()))
16682  {
16683  parent.erase(it);
16684  }
16685  else
16686  {
16687  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(403, "key '" + last_path + "' not found"));
16688  }
16689  }
16690  else if (parent.is_array())
16691  {
16692  // note erase performs range check
16693  parent.erase(static_cast<size_type>(json_pointer::array_index(last_path)));
16694  }
16695  };
16696 
16697  // type check: top level value must be an array
16698  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not json_patch.is_array()))
16699  {
16700  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(104, 0, "JSON patch must be an array of objects"));
16701  }
16702 
16703  // iterate and apply the operations
16704  for (const auto& val : json_patch)
16705  {
16706  // wrapper to get a value for an operation
16707  const auto get_value = [&val](const std::string & op,
16708  const std::string & member,
16709  bool string_type) -> basic_json &
16710  {
16711  // find value
16712  auto it = val.m_value.object->find(member);
16713 
16714  // context-sensitive error message
16715  const auto error_msg = (op == "op") ? "operation" : "operation '" + op + "'";
16716 
16717  // check if desired value is present
16718  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(it == val.m_value.object->end()))
16719  {
16720  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(105, 0, error_msg + " must have member '" + member + "'"));
16721  }
16722 
16723  // check if result is of type string
16724  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(string_type and not it->second.is_string()))
16725  {
16726  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(105, 0, error_msg + " must have string member '" + member + "'"));
16727  }
16728 
16729  // no error: return value
16730  return it->second;
16731  };
16732 
16733  // type check: every element of the array must be an object
16734  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not val.is_object()))
16735  {
16736  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(104, 0, "JSON patch must be an array of objects"));
16737  }
16738 
16739  // collect mandatory members
16740  const std::string op = get_value("op", "op", true);
16741  const std::string path = get_value(op, "path", true);
16742  json_pointer ptr(path);
16743 
16744  switch (get_op(op))
16745  {
16746  case patch_operations::add:
16747  {
16748  operation_add(ptr, get_value("add", "value", false));
16749  break;
16750  }
16751 
16752  case patch_operations::remove:
16753  {
16754  operation_remove(ptr);
16755  break;
16756  }
16757 
16758  case patch_operations::replace:
16759  {
16760  // the "path" location must exist - use at()
16761  result.at(ptr) = get_value("replace", "value", false);
16762  break;
16763  }
16764 
16765  case patch_operations::move:
16766  {
16767  const std::string from_path = get_value("move", "from", true);
16768  json_pointer from_ptr(from_path);
16769 
16770  // the "from" location must exist - use at()
16771  basic_json v = result.at(from_ptr);
16772 
16773  // The move operation is functionally identical to a
16774  // "remove" operation on the "from" location, followed
16775  // immediately by an "add" operation at the target
16776  // location with the value that was just removed.
16777  operation_remove(from_ptr);
16778  operation_add(ptr, v);
16779  break;
16780  }
16781 
16782  case patch_operations::copy:
16783  {
16784  const std::string from_path = get_value("copy", "from", true);
16785  const json_pointer from_ptr(from_path);
16786 
16787  // the "from" location must exist - use at()
16788  basic_json v = result.at(from_ptr);
16789 
16790  // The copy is functionally identical to an "add"
16791  // operation at the target location using the value
16792  // specified in the "from" member.
16793  operation_add(ptr, v);
16794  break;
16795  }
16796 
16797  case patch_operations::test:
16798  {
16799  bool success = false;
16800  JSON_TRY
16801  {
16802  // check if "value" matches the one at "path"
16803  // the "path" location must exist - use at()
16804  success = (result.at(ptr) == get_value("test", "value", false));
16805  }
16806  JSON_CATCH (out_of_range&)
16807  {
16808  // ignore out of range errors: success remains false
16809  }
16810 
16811  // throw an exception if test fails
16812  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not success))
16813  {
16814  JSON_THROW(other_error::create(501, "unsuccessful: " + val.dump()));
16815  }
16816 
16817  break;
16818  }
16819 
16820  case patch_operations::invalid:
16821  {
16822  // op must be "add", "remove", "replace", "move", "copy", or
16823  // "test"
16824  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(105, 0, "operation value '" + op + "' is invalid"));
16825  }
16826  }
16827  }
16828 
16829  return result;
16830  }
16831 
16865  static basic_json diff(const basic_json& source, const basic_json& target,
16866  const std::string& path = "")
16867  {
16868  // the patch
16869  basic_json result(value_t::array);
16870 
16871  // if the values are the same, return empty patch
16872  if (source == target)
16873  {
16874  return result;
16875  }
16876 
16877  if (source.type() != target.type())
16878  {
16879  // different types: replace value
16880  result.push_back(
16881  {
16882  {"op", "replace"}, {"path", path}, {"value", target}
16883  });
16884  }
16885  else
16886  {
16887  switch (source.type())
16888  {
16889  case value_t::array:
16890  {
16891  // first pass: traverse common elements
16892  std::size_t i = 0;
16893  while (i < source.size() and i < target.size())
16894  {
16895  // recursive call to compare array values at index i
16896  auto temp_diff = diff(source[i], target[i], path + "/" + std::to_string(i));
16897  result.insert(result.end(), temp_diff.begin(), temp_diff.end());
16898  ++i;
16899  }
16900 
16901  // i now reached the end of at least one array
16902  // in a second pass, traverse the remaining elements
16903 
16904  // remove my remaining elements
16905  const auto end_index = static_cast<difference_type>(result.size());
16906  while (i < source.size())
16907  {
16908  // add operations in reverse order to avoid invalid
16909  // indices
16910  result.insert(result.begin() + end_index, object(
16911  {
16912  {"op", "remove"},
16913  {"path", path + "/" + std::to_string(i)}
16914  }));
16915  ++i;
16916  }
16917 
16918  // add other remaining elements
16919  while (i < target.size())
16920  {
16921  result.push_back(
16922  {
16923  {"op", "add"},
16924  {"path", path + "/" + std::to_string(i)},
16925  {"value", target[i]}
16926  });
16927  ++i;
16928  }
16929 
16930  break;
16931  }
16932 
16933  case value_t::object:
16934  {
16935  // first pass: traverse this object's elements
16936  for (auto it = source.cbegin(); it != source.cend(); ++it)
16937  {
16938  // escape the key name to be used in a JSON patch
16939  const auto key = json_pointer::escape(it.key());
16940 
16941  if (target.find(it.key()) != target.end())
16942  {
16943  // recursive call to compare object values at key it
16944  auto temp_diff = diff(it.value(), target[it.key()], path + "/" + key);
16945  result.insert(result.end(), temp_diff.begin(), temp_diff.end());
16946  }
16947  else
16948  {
16949  // found a key that is not in o -> remove it
16950  result.push_back(object(
16951  {
16952  {"op", "remove"}, {"path", path + "/" + key}
16953  }));
16954  }
16955  }
16956 
16957  // second pass: traverse other object's elements
16958  for (auto it = target.cbegin(); it != target.cend(); ++it)
16959  {
16960  if (source.find(it.key()) == source.end())
16961  {
16962  // found a key that is not in this -> add it
16963  const auto key = json_pointer::escape(it.key());
16964  result.push_back(
16965  {
16966  {"op", "add"}, {"path", path + "/" + key},
16967  {"value", it.value()}
16968  });
16969  }
16970  }
16971 
16972  break;
16973  }
16974 
16975  default:
16976  {
16977  // both primitive type: replace value
16978  result.push_back(
16979  {
16980  {"op", "replace"}, {"path", path}, {"value", target}
16981  });
16982  break;
16983  }
16984  }
16985  }
16986 
16987  return result;
16988  }
16989 
16991 
16993  // JSON Merge Patch functions //
16995 
16998 
17041  void merge_patch(const basic_json& patch)
17042  {
17043  if (patch.is_object())
17044  {
17045  if (not is_object())
17046  {
17047  *this = object();
17048  }
17049  for (auto it = patch.begin(); it != patch.end(); ++it)
17050  {
17051  if (it.value().is_null())
17052  {
17053  erase(it.key());
17054  }
17055  else
17056  {
17057  operator[](it.key()).merge_patch(it.value());
17058  }
17059  }
17060  }
17061  else
17062  {
17063  *this = patch;
17064  }
17065  }
17066 
17068 };
17069 } // namespace nlohmann
17070 
17072 // nonmember support //
17074 
17075 // specialization of std::swap, and std::hash
17076 namespace std
17077 {
17083 template<>
17084 inline void swap(nlohmann::json& j1,
17085  nlohmann::json& j2) noexcept(
17086  is_nothrow_move_constructible<nlohmann::json>::value and
17087  is_nothrow_move_assignable<nlohmann::json>::value
17088  )
17089 {
17090  j1.swap(j2);
17091 }
17092 
17094 template<>
17095 struct hash<nlohmann::json>
17096 {
17102  std::size_t operator()(const nlohmann::json& j) const
17103  {
17104  // a naive hashing via the string representation
17105  const auto& h = hash<nlohmann::json::string_t>();
17106  return h(j.dump());
17107  }
17108 };
17109 
17113 template<>
17114 struct less< ::nlohmann::detail::value_t>
17115 {
17120  bool operator()(nlohmann::detail::value_t lhs,
17121  nlohmann::detail::value_t rhs) const noexcept
17122  {
17123  return nlohmann::detail::operator<(lhs, rhs);
17124  }
17125 };
17126 
17127 } // namespace std
17128 
17142 inline nlohmann::json operator "" _json(const char* s, std::size_t n)
17143 {
17144  return nlohmann::json::parse(s, s + n);
17145 }
17146 
17160 inline nlohmann::json::json_pointer operator "" _json_pointer(const char* s, std::size_t n)
17161 {
17162  return nlohmann::json::json_pointer(std::string(s, n));
17163 }

17170  #pragma GCC diagnostic pop
17171 #endif
